4493722/4414128/4527814.title: Local Cures - Warts
4493722/4414128/4527814.text:
When I have a wart on my finger, I go to a tree in which there is a hole and put my finger into the water in this tree and I never tell anyone, and soon the wart goes away.



A Common Cold.When I have a cold my Mother warms buttermilk, and puts paper in it, and gives it to me to drink.  This cures my cold.

4493722/4414132/4527826.title: Local Cures - Whooping-Cough
4493722/4414132/4527826.text:
When I had whooping cough, my mother put some linseed meal into a bowl of hot water and gave it to me. This cured the cough.



When my brother was off work with the cold, my mother gave him a lemon drinking an aispirin, and that cured his cold.

4562127/4561800/4569564.title: (no title)
4562127/4561800/4569564.text:
There was a man in Belclare one time and he was a shoemaker. One day a man called to him and asked him to make a pair of boots. This he did and when the man asked him how much they were the shoemaker wrote something on a piece of paper and gave it to the man, who went away. Some years later the man came again and brought the shoemaker to the top of a hill and gave him as much land as he could see. This man (as per story) was Cromwell



Get (I) 6 eggs(II) 6 lemon(III) 1 lb of brown sugar(IIII) 1/2 pint of rumBreak the eggs and put into lemon juice shells included. Leave for 24 hours. Add rum and sugar to heal well.

4649689/4647438/4650768.title: A Cure for Wind on Stomach
4649689/4647438/4650768.text:
A Cure for Wind on Stomach.Watercress after being eaten raw two or three times will relive wind on stomach completeMrs Pinkman,Borrick,Keshcarrigan.Cure for sore throat.The juice pressed from a turnip mixed with sugar is believed to sooth and be a cure for a sore throat.A Cure for a Cold.A good cure for a cold to boil buttermilk and sugar together; This is called "buttermilk whey" , and take a drink of going to bed at night.Lizzie Beirme.



The juice pressed from a turnip mixed with sugar is believed to sooth and be a cure for a sore throat.



A good cure for a cold to boil buttermilk and sugar together; This is called "buttermilk whey", and take a drink of it going to bed at night.

4658420/4653230/4662451.title: A Cure for a Cold
4658420/4653230/4662451.text: In olden times the Irish people did not believe in Doctors, and for colds and other diseases. There were what they called home quacks to make up cures out of herbs and other ingredients.One old cure they had for a cold was, boil some buttermilk take off the curds and sweeten to taste with sugar and flavour with garlic.

Get an onion and wet a piece of brown paper and roll it up and pull out some of the griosae and leave it there for a half an hour. Lift it and cut it in two halves and throw away one half and eat the other half.You have to take it for about four nights. You have to throw away and when you do it takes away the cold and the other brings good health to you.

4658420/4653259/4662515.title: A Cure for a Cold
4658420/4653259/4662515.text: There are a lot of cures for a cold around this locality. One of them is made up of sugar and vinegar and curds of whey, these are all minced up and boiled. It has to be taken for three nights before you go to bed and after that it is supposed to be better. There is also another one one pint of porter i boiled and sugar is put on it. It has to be taken before you go to bed

4658420/4653271/4662579.title: A Cure for a Cold
4658420/4653271/4662579.text: Get an onion and wet a piece of brown paper and roll it up and pull out some of the griosach and leave it there for a half an hour. Lift it and cut it in two halves and throw away one half and eat the other half.You have to take it for about four nights. You have to throw away one half every night and when you do it takes away the cold and the other brings good health to you.

4658420/4653277/4662594.title: Cures for a Cold
4658420/4653277/4662594.text:
Some people who have colds stay in bed. They take medecine such as boiled butter, milk made into whey, or whiskey or rum. Bovril is often taken as well. That is medecine necessary for colds.

Colds1)  Put brown paper soaked in turpentine on the chest (Mrs. Bracken, Celbridge in Co. Down)

4742056/4731350/4815585.title: Cures - Colds
4742056/4731350/4815585.text: Eat garlic or sea-weed now better known as Carrigeen Moss.Quarter an onion and put a portion in the four corners of the room on going to bed. Your cold will have disappeared by morning.A bowl of hot buttermilk or buttermilk gruel with plenty of sugar and butter in it taken in bed and a a good hot jar to your feet you will be well in the morning.In the west of Ireland the old people hold that a good strong glass of punch made from mountain dew and a mustard footbath taken just before bed will make you as "fit as a fiddle" in the morning.Flaxseed boiled and strained with lemon juice, honey liquorice ball added and taken is very good for a cold.

4742023/4728816/4817314.title: (no title)
4742023/4728816/4817314.text: Cure for a cold:- Scalded butter-milk and sugar.Cure for a cough:- 2 roasted lemons, 1 lb. of brown sugar, 1 naggin of white wine vinegar, boil four handfulls of ivy leaves and then drain the water from the leaves and mix the mixtures through the water and then to drink it.Inward pain:- Long ago when a child would take an inward pain the child's mother and father would would hand the child one to another under a donkey's belly and make the sign of a cross and say: "In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost Amen"

Pain in the BackJurpentine sprinkled on red flannel and applied to the back



LumbagoA mixture of salt and mustard on red flannel



Sore throatWell heated salt in a woollen stocking which is tied round the throat on retiring to bed



A cold1. An onion is boiled in a pint of new milk and drunk as hot as possible. The patient must remain in bed for a day or two2. Bathe the feet in hot water and mustard



Ear-acheA piece of cotton wool steeped in hot olive oil placed in the ear gives relief2. Hold the ear over the stream of a jug of boiling water3. Squeeze a portion of a cut onion, and allow a few drops of the juice into the ear.4. The centre of an onion heated at the fire and inserted in the ear.

4922247/4864029/5051891.title: Cure for Colds
4922247/4864029/5051891.text: When a person had a cold he  goes to the nearest stream and gathers some of the watercress, steeped it before using it. A sick stomach was cured but a few spoonfuls of bread soda, disolved in hot waterChilblains + corns were cured by mustard and ointment mixed.
4922247/4864029/5051891.school_info: School: Presentation Convent, Carraig na Siúire

4922271/4866155/5072094.title: Cures - A Cold
4922271/4866155/5072094.text:
I heard a very good cure for a cold at home from my grandmother one wet night. The cure is to drink some dandelion. You should boil some dandelion and then drink some of it.The old people used to call it dandelion wine.



I found out a cure for boils at home. This is the cure:- every morning and night you should get white bread and put it to the boil. You should make sure that the bread is hot. You must do this for a week or a fortnight. You will find that after a fortnight your boil will be cured.



This is the cure for wildfire. A certain family of the Cahill's in the parish of Cloghan can cure wildfire by putting a cut on their finger and by rubbing the blood round the wildfire. It will stop the disease from spreading and will cure it in a few days. My father told me this story a short time ago.



I heard of a cure for warts. The following is the cure. By going to a garden and getting a weed called the milk weed.
(continues on next page)

5008826/4959208/5072941.title: Blood Puddings
5008826/4959208/5072941.text:
(continued from previous page)
mixture was then poured into the pigs' puddings which had been cleaned. The puddings were then boiled. One could scarcely imagine anything tastier.



Brooklime, dandelion, hound's tongue, tips of furze, sugar of candy, liquorice and water. Boiled down till one pint becomes half a pint.



Black sulphur, Oliver snuff and bog's lard made into an ointment and applied to the affected part after the latter has been scraped

5008874/4962806/5080817.title: (no title)
5008874/4962806/5080817.text:
(continued from previous page)
Another cure is to give the milk which the ferret leaves after it when drinking, to the person who has the whooping cough. Another still is to give some of the moss that grows on Monasterboice Cross, and boil it on milk, and give the milk to the person to drink.If a person, is very bad with a pain, gather some of that creeper called, "Robin run the hedge" and boil it on some milk, and give it to the person to drink, and it will cure him.St Patricks Leaf is the cure of a sore, one side of it draws and the other side heals.



For a cold they boiled garlic or flaxseed and it was taken hot.Another was for whooping cough. A
(continues on next page)

5008960/4971078/5109437.title: Rheumatism
5008960/4971078/5109437.text:
It is said that if you get Marsh mellows and boil them. Then bathe the place where you have Rheumatism and it will cure it.



The cure for a cold is to boil some buttermilk and drink it going to bed.



This cure is well known in my district. Mix the juice of a mangold with some Caster Oil, mix it well and put it on the burn.



The cure for this sickness is to get the second bark of an elm, boil it well and drink the substance.



The cure for this is not known by many people. You get a garden bean and chew it. Put the chewed bean on the place the thorn and tie a tight bandage round it. Leave it on over night. The thorn
(continues on next page)

5070818/5067281/5110621.title: Cold or Sore Throat
5070818/5067281/5110621.text: Garlic was supposed to be a great cure for a cold or sore throat. By drinking the garlic and taking it with sweetender with sugar at night going the cold is cured

5008962/4971266/5110948.title: Warts
5008962/4971266/5110948.text:
(continued from previous page)
have on your hands. They are not sore but they do a person's skin harm. To cure them get a snail and put it on them and leave it on for five minutes. They they will go away in a short time.



People often have lumbago. It is a very sore thing to have but it is said if you rake glauber salts every second morning you will never get it again.



If a person has a bad cold and a cough, heat camphorated oil and rub it to his chest and put brown paper over it and the cough will get easier and wear away.



If a little baby took convulsions put him in a bath of hot water and put a cold sponge
(continues on next page)

5008962/4971272/5111140.title: Nose Bleeding
5008962/4971272/5111140.text:
Put a cold key down the person's back. If a child is affected give it some paper to chew, but be careful not to allow it to swallow it.



If a child gets a cold rub its chest with sweet oil night and morning for about five minutes.



Apply a little fresh butter or olive oil and renew every quarter of an hour for two or three hours.



Long ago people used to put a cobweb on a cut to stop it from bleeding. A puffin which
(continues on next page)

5008974/4972550/5111983.title: Cold
5008974/4972550/5111983.text:
An old cure is to drink boiled buttermilk and plenty of sugar in it. This drink sweats you and if you repeat the dose a few nights the cold will be cured. Another cure is to drink boiled flaxseed and some lemon juice and sugar.



A cure is to get nine ivy leaves and hang them up and when they begin to decay the warts will also disappear.

metadata.Teacher:: Máirtín Ó Loingsigh, R. Ó Fithcheallaigh

5008974/4972552/5111994.title: Scalds
5008974/4972552/5111994.text:
A cure for a scald is to get a lot of loral leaves and cut them up in fine pieces and mix and lard among them and then boil them and when they are boiled strane the juice out of them and and put it in a box or a jar and leave it there for about an hour and it will be like lard, and then you could put it on the scald..



Bathe your feet in hot water to which mustard is added then get into bed quickly and drink, boiled buttermilk and plenty of sugar in it.

metadata.Teacher:: Máirtín Ó Loingsigh, R. Ó Fithcheallaigh

5044582/5023897/5140680.text:
(2) Fine sugar and soap mixed together put on brown paper will cure biles



Measels:- hot drinks and punch.



Erysipselas:- Scorched flour and new white flannel.



Hand Cracks: A cure for hand cracks is to melt wax and put it into the cracks.



Colds:- 1. Boiled butter-milk and a lump of butter and sugar is a great cure for a cold.2.Another cure for a cold is boiled flaxseed and a lemon.



3. Another cure is black currant jam made into punch.



Asthma:- Raw turnips and brown sugar.



Sty in your eye:- Squirt a drop of cows milk from the udder of the cow into the eye,2. Prod the sty with three gooseberry thorns for nine mornings. The three thorns must be put away in a piece of paper.

5044690/5032474/5145980.title: To Cure a Cold - A Posset
5044690/5032474/5145980.text:
Boil two cups of buttermilk well. Put one spoonful of butter into the milk. Then put in one or two teaspoonfuls of sugar and a pinch of salt with some ginger. It is a great cure for a cold or a sore neck.



Boil six or seven potatoes and peel and mash them.  Then get four cupsful of flour in a basin, add bread soda to flour and mix well.  Mix in potatoes, add salt, wet  with sour milk and knead it well.  Roll out thinly and put it into a hot oven or pan and bake for half an hour.  These are eaten while hot well buttered.

4921693/4890575/5153730.title: Cures for a Cold
4921693/4890575/5153730.text: 1. Drink hot milk with peppermint going to bed.2. Hot milk in which an onion was boiled.3. Boil a nail (iron) in milk and drink milk very hot going to bed.4.Onions cut very small placed in  a cup or glass with alternative layers of sugar. After standing for an hour or so, the sugar has turned into syrup which is splendid for cough, sore throat or hoarseness5. Carrigen boiled in milk and taken very hot before going to bed is another splendid remedy.
4921693/4890575/5153730.school_info: School: Cnoc an Chuilinn, An Ráth Mhór

4921895/4899320/5182475.title: (no title)
4921895/4899320/5182475.text: Boiled turnips were used for colds and lung trouble. These turnips were not peeled but cut and put into milk to boil. They were allowed to boil until they were made into syrup. This syrup was always kept in the house, and was used when retiring to bed.   The cure for consumption was a little plant called [?]"Mara Coinal]. This plant was boiled in milk, and was taken morning and evening. The cure for rheumatism was a plant called "lus na pingne" or "lus na bpingne". This plant grew in marshy places and was boiled in spring water, and the mixture was taken often.

5215811/5214440/5235107.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214440/5235107.text:
Many cures can be obtained from the herbs in the fields if the people know how to use them. There is a class of weed growing in the field called 'sally weed' , which is a great cure for a cold.Pull this weed and get the root of it. Wash the root very clean, and take off the outside skin.Then boil it in about one quart of water, for twenty minutes.Then strain the juice from the root and bottle it for about one week. Then take one spoon.
(continues on next page)

5215811/5214442/5235108.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214442/5235108.text: One very good cure for a cold is first get even nettle tops, wash them, put them in a vesel to boil, with half a glass of vinegar, two spoonfuls of glouber salts, four spoonfuls of carroways seeds, and half a glass of whisky and lave them down to boil for twenty minutes.Then lift them up and strain the juice into a jug, and cover it for fourteen hours. Then take too spoonfuls of it every morning before your breakfast, and very soon your cold will disappear.

5215811/5214443/5235109.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214443/5235109.text: Here is a very good cure for a cold. Get a saucepan, clean it and put some oatmeal into it, and half a cup of buttermilk. Then leave it on the fire to boil for about quarter of an hour and keep stirring all the time.Take it up then, and put three spoonfuls of sugar; and half a cup of milk on it, and take this before you go to bed at night, and you will find that your cold will be gone in the morning.

5215811/5214474/5235134.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214474/5235134.text:
Here is a good cure for a cold. Get a handful of carrigeen moss which every home should have in its possession, and have a saucepan cleaned, place the carrigeen moss in the saucepan with a pint of water, do not have any more water or it will be too thin, and if possible use warm water. Put the saucepan over the fire and boil for half an hour or longer. Lift up the pan and strain the carrigeen moss through a very fine strainer so that no twigs of carrigeen are in the syrup, because they are useless now that all the juice is from them. Get a lemon and prick a hole in it with a fork, squeeze the juice from it into the saucepan containing the
(continues on next page)

5215811/5214476/5235135.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214476/5235135.text:
There are many cures or colds nowadays but here is one in particular that is very reliable. Get a saucepan and clean it throughly. Put a cupful of course oaten-meal into it. Fine meal of course will do, but it is much better to have course meal. Place a good cupful of  milk into the saucepan containing the oaten meal, and put an airtight lid on it, to prevent and dust entering it. Bring it to the boil slowly. Lift it from the fire and put a print of butter about the size of an egg and flour or five spoons of sugar into it, stir well. Put on the fire and boil for 5 minutes. Before going to bed every night take a cupful
(continues on next page)

5215811/5214478/5235136.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214478/5235136.text: A very good cure for a cold is; get a good-sized onion, and put it on some red-hot coals by the fire. Leave it there for a while, until it is dark brown and quiet soft. Then lift it up on a fork or otherwise you may urn your fingers. Peal off the outside skin, and eat it while still hot. If you like you can use some salt, because it makes it more palatable, and it puts a good wholesome taste on it. For my own part I certainly like salt on the onion don in the way i have before said, for your cold, to you, and mark my words your cold will disappear.

5215811/5214504/5235159.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214504/5235159.text: This is a very good cure for a cold, this plant cured many a person, the name of this plant is rose-noble. You would get this plant growing along a wall in dry land. Clean your plant well and put it in a small pot, and put about one quart of after and put it down to boil, when it is boiled you strain it and put it into some vessel, until it gets cold. Then take this first thing in the morning and last thing at night, and your cold will soon disappear.

5215811/5214505/5235162.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214505/5235162.text: This is a very good cure for a cold. Get a pot of black currant jam, and get a cup and put two or three spoonfuls of this jam into the cup, and fill the cup with hot water. Take this drink when you are going to bed and your cold will be gone in the morning, but you have to stay in bed for two or three days after taking this.

5215811/5214506/5235163.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214506/5235163.text: Here is a very good cure for a cold. Get a root of garlic and wash it, and clean a saucepan and put this root into the saucepan, and put one cup of milk into it, and put it down to boil. When it is boiled take it up and leave it to get cold. Take this drink first thing in the morning and your cold will soon vanish.

5215811/5214530/5235238.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214530/5235238.text: This is a cure for a cold that my grandmother told me. Get a saucepan and clean it well, then put a cupful of fresh butter-milk into the saucepan, leave it on the fire to boil into whey, keep stirring it or else it will form curd. Take it up and put one oz of utter into the boiling whey, put two spoons of sugar in it, leave it on the fire again for about four minutes, and take it as hot as you can going to bed, for a few nights and your cold will be better.

5215811/5214531/5235239.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214531/5235239.text: Here is a cure for a cold, get the tops of young nettles and wash them in boiling water, and boil them in a clean pot. Leave them to boil for an hour, then lift them and strain the juice in a bowl, Put an egg cup of glauber salt, a spoonful of barroway seeds, and a half glass of whisky in the juice, and take a cup of this syrup every night going to bed, and your cold will be better.

5215811/5214532/5235240.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214532/5235240.text: Get a saucepan and wash, and clean it, put a pint of buttermilk in it, and leave it on the fire until the milk is boiling. Then put a cupful of oaten meal in the sauce-pan, keep stirring the gruel, or it will become little lumps. Take it up, and put an ounce of butter, and four spoons of sugar in the gruel. Take it hot going to bed, and your cold will vanish.

5215811/5214559/5235283.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214559/5235283.text: I have heard many old people tell of cures for a cold so i will tell you one of them. Get some flax-seed , sugar-candy, and liquorice and boil them all up together until they become as thin as water. Then pour it into a vessel and leave it there to get cold. Take the full of an egg cup of this every night and morning, and your cold will soon vanish.

5215811/5214560/5235285.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214560/5235285.text: Get one pint of skim milk and put it into a lean saucepan and on the fire. When it is well warm get about four oz of eaten meal and put it in with the milk. Leave it on fire until it is boiled keeping it stirred all the time, or it will go into curds. Take two spoonfuls of this as hot as possible before you go to bed at night and your cold will not be long going.

5215811/5214561/5235291.title: Cures for a Cold
5215811/5214561/5235291.text: Get an egg, break it and put the white of it into a bowl. Then get a fork and keep stirring it until it becomes thick. Then get two spoonfuls of sugar and put them into the bowl also, and stir it once or twice. Leave it for about half an hour to set and then eat it with a spoon, about an hour before you go to bed, and your cold will be gone in the morning.
